name: The World of George Smiley Online Quiz | Authors | 10 Questions

questions.text: George Smiley works for British Intelligence based at 'the Circus'. Where is 'the Circus'?
questions.explanation:
Cambridge Circus.

	The HQ was at Cambridge Circus, at the junction of Charing Cross Road and Shaftesbury Avenue in the West End, central London.

Ann.

	Lady Ann Sercomb, daughter of a decaying Cornish noble family, who met George when his boss' secretary, and flits in and out of George's life.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT one of George's aliases or worknames?
questions.explanation:
Hector.

	Max was Smiley's main {workname;} Hector was the workname of his side-kick, Toby Esterhase. Smiley travelled under the names Standfast and {Barraclough;} he also uses the names Leber and Lorrimer at different times.

questions.text: What is the workname of Smiley's great enemy, the director of Moscow Centre?
questions.explanation:
Karla.

	Karla is described as Smiley's 'black grail', or his Moriarty. Karla also appears under the name 'Gerstmann' in his early days as a spy in India.

Chelsea.

	He studied in Oxford but now lives in Bywater Street, Chelsea, West London. Other characters in the novels, Oliver Lacon and Vladimir Miller, live in Ascot and Paddington respectively.

questions.text: Toby Esterhase runs the section who carry out observations, organise equipment and run courier jobs: what is the section called?
questions.explanation:
Lamplighters.

	The Lamplighters, based at Acton, are the organisers. Scalphunters, based at Brixton, are the heavies. The Wranglers are the radio experts and code breakers. The Inquisitors train agents and question defectors.

US intelligence.

	The Cousins is the nickname given to the CIA.

questions.text: Who is George's closest female colleague?
questions.explanation:
Connie Sachs.

	Connie is former Head of Research at the Circus, an eccentric with an expert knowledge of soviet spys, nicknamed 'Mother Russia'. Diana Dolphin and Molly Purcell are senior administrators at the Circus, Millie McCraig is housekeeper of a safe house used by the service.

questions.text: What is the workname of George's boss at the Circus?
questions.explanation:
Control.

	He is known throughout the books as Control, his real name is never revealed. The General is Vladimir Miller's title in 'Smiley's People'. Gerald is the codename for the mole in 'Tinker, Tailor'. M is a character in James Bond stories.

questions.text: Which of these places is NOT a key location in 'Tinker, Tailor'?
questions.explanation:
Berne.

	Hamburg, Berne and Berlin are all important in 'Smiley's People'. London, Paris and Oxford feature in both novels.
